thread.title: Please, Dodgers, play ball, not Beethoven
thread.title_full: Please, Dodgers, play ball, not Beethoven - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Henry Schulman
title: Please, Dodgers, play ball, not Beethoven
text:
Photo: Sean M. Haffey, Getty Images Every home strikeout from Clayton Kershaw, 163 of them in 2015, was accompanied by an annoying repetition of the opening bars from Beethoven’s “Fifth.” Every home strikeout from Clayton Kershaw, 163 of them in 2015, was...
This is not going to be an anti-Dodgers screed. I have nothing against them. I grew up in L.A. and learned to love baseball at Chavez Ravine with my dad. Fine organization, beautiful park, Vin Scully, lots of championships, blah blah blah. Every home strikeout from Clayton Kershaw, 163 of them in 2015, was accompanied by an annoying repetition of the opening bars from Beethoven’s “Fifth.” Every home strikeout from Clayton Kershaw, 163 of them in 2015, was...
